r4092 | rabbit | 2008-02-21 14:28:04 +0000 (Thu, 21 Feb 2008) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Prototype.lua

BigWigs: Prototype: Add new API, :AddSyncListener -- might be renamed and argument list is not set in stone yet. Syntax: AddSyncListener(event, spellId1, spellId2, ..., syncToken, argument1, argument2, ...) where spellId# is a list of spell IDs the sync token should be transmitted on and argument# is a list of the argument numbers normally sent to the combat listeners to include in the sync (player, spellId, spellName and event) - i.e. just '1' to transmit the player along with the sync token, or '1, 4' to transmit the player and the event that triggered the sync.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

BigWigs: Bars:
 * Only register the candy bar groups once.
 * Set the growup state and start point when the settings change, and not on every bar start.
 * Remove debug print.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r3183 | rabbit | 2007-07-18 22:03:37 +0000 (Wed, 18 Jul 2007) | 5 lines
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Plugins/Bars.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Plugins/Colors.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Plugins/Messages.lua

BigWigs:
 * No longer register hex codes with PaintChips-2.0 and converts stuff back and forth, instead, colors are saved directly as RGB pairs and fed to the relevant displays with no conversion in-between.
 * As a consequence, of course, other addons using PaintChips-2.0 will no longer have access to the BigWigs message priority colors by name -- if this is a problem, please let me know, and I'll register them.
 * BigWigs still requires PaintChips-2.0, since we want to be able to say stuff like "White" and "Green" and others when we display messages as well.
 * Needs testing, please provide me with some feedback on how it works.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r3182 | sayclub | 2007-07-18 09:09:12 +0000 (Wed, 18 Jul 2007) | 1 line

   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/BlackTemple/Souls.lua

r2450 | rabbit | 2007-04-04 14:32:18 +0000 (Wed, 04 Apr 2007) | 5 lines
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Core.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/LoadOnDemand.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Plugins/Version.lua

BigWigs:
 * Console commands now use the full zone name, as specified in X-BigWigs-LoadInZone or X-BigWigs-Menu, translated by Babble-Zone. This means that any zone present in BZ can be used as a menu key.
 Of course, as a side effect of this change, the console commands /bigwigs and /bw no longer use abbreviated zone names like ZG or AQ20, but require the full zone names. This does not effect any GUI settings, like the dewdrop menu or waterfall dialog.

Please test this for other locales to make sure it works, especially koKR and zhTW.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

BigWigs:
 * Modules no longer mixin CandyBar, instead we handle everything in the Bars module.
 * All bossmod toggle options are now mapped directly to a key in the translation table instead of option_name, to avoid extra string concatenation on load. Note that some external modules might need to be updated.

BigWigs:
 * Some changes to reduce the number of functions created for option tables.
 * No longer checks your current zone vs the modules when enabling modules locally, since the target monitor should already handle that.
 * Fix the target monitor to check all the zone functions (Get(Real|Sub)ZoneText()).
 * Don't re-create the tablet hint on every update.
 * Finally fix separators in boss menus moving around.
 * Don't access globals accidentally, which is what bugged oRA2 for a long time (we tried to access |cons| 2 places).
 * Use the new prototype shorthand methods for Core:EnableModule.
 * This checkin probably broke something; beware.

BigWigs:
 * Zones are now displayed on the top level menu, reduces the distance you have to travel to toggle boss options.
 * Bosses in zones that don't have a direct translation in BigWigs' internal AceLocale table will be put in to the Other "zone". Onyxia's Lair was removed from the table, so she will be under the Other zone as well now, along with Emeriss, etc.
 * Some cleanup of the BigWigs AL table and rearrange some SurfaceLib code.

* Sending of CustomBars is now throttled at max 2 seconds per unique bar (time + message)
* Incoming custombar throttle removed. This allows for multiple /bwcb or BWCB() in one macro.

BigWigs:
 * Added different icons for enabled/disabled state which you can toggle with /bw standby, thanks to Mikk for the icons.
 * Test module does not need Babble-Boss
 * All BigWigs modules will disable when BW Core disables, and all non-boss modules will be enabled when it enables. BigWigs_CoreEnabled and BigWigs_CoreDisabled events are sent in these cases.
 * The config groups Bosses, Plugins and Extras are no longer available when BW is disabled.
 * Tooltip can now be detached since it is actually useful for something.

BigWigs: Fixing 54 files with invalid svn:keywords.  'rev' and 'date' are
-not- valid.  'Rev' and 'Date' are.  Per http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.1/ch07s02.html,
svn keywords are case sensitive.

r111 | tekkub | 2006-06-10 21:24:16 +0000 (Sat, 10 Jun 2006) | 8 lines
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Bars.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/BigWigs.toc
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Core.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Messages.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Other/Test.lua
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Sound.lua

BigWigs
- Moved Savedvar to a SavedvarPerChar, so no need for profiling logic (wewt!)
- Added proper module slash command handing, so now modules can add slosh commands, see message/sound/bars modules for examples.
- Added Savedvariable management.  Every module will receive GetOpt, SetOpt, TogOpt methods when they register with the core.  ***BIG NOTE READ ME*** This is _NOT_ AceDB style Opt methods, they will return back values from the modules' own subtable of the savedvar table.  Also they do not take tables as arg paths, but rather up to 9 strings.  You shouldn't need more than one level deep tho...
- Seperated scale and anchor commands into the msg/bar modules, they are now independant of each other
- Added option to have bars grow upwards from the bar anchor
- Added option to disable the sound module.
- Remove code no longer used, note that all the new command tables are going to need localized
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r102 | tekkub | 2006-06-09 19:58:38 +0000 (Fri, 09 Jun 2006) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/Comm.lua

BigWigs - Added throttle code to the Comm module.  To register a message for throttling fire off a "BIGWIGS_SYNC_THROTTLE" event with args msg, time.  Time is in seconds.  If time is nil the throttle is erased.  This will supress repeat events from firing for x seconds after the first one does.

r59 | tekkub | 2006-05-09 00:09:04 +0000 (Tue, 09 May 2006) | 6 lines
Changed paths:
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs
   M /tmp/trunk/BigWigs/BigWigs.toc

BigWigs - Okey children... *activate parental mode*
hand: Shyva set up seperate methods for not-korean locale, and I much prefer that method.  You're locale is different and needs a different method, we undersatnd that.  Please don't change anything that requires you to edit the english locales, just use the "if GetLocale() == "koKR" trick that Shva put in some time back.  That will load your method if it's your locale, or the original method if it's not.

What I'm trying to say here is basically, don't mess with code for locales that aren't your own, just conditionally replace them :P

And why are we doing this in commit notes?
------------------------------------------------------------------------
